titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Suffolk County, New York subpoena records 1977.451
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-11-29 18:33:51 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Suffolk County, New York subpoena records
did.abstract: The collection consists of two subpoenas concerning the court case of William Smith, circa 1700 to 1750. The proceedings concerned property boundaries and a trespassing charge.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The two documents in this collection are housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Suffolk County, New York subpoena records, 1977.451, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two subpoenas concerning the court case of William Smith, circa 1700 to 1750. The proceedings concerned property boundaries and a trespassing charge.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

controlaccess.genreform: Court records -- New York (State) -- Suffolk County
